skill.name: flutter-animations
skill.description: Comprehensive guide for implementing animations in Flutter. Use when adding motion and visual effects to Flutter apps: implicit animations (AnimatedContainer, AnimatedOpacity, TweenAnimationBuilder), explicit animations (AnimationController, Tween, AnimatedWidget/AnimatedBuilder), hero animations (shared element transitions), staggered animations (sequential/overlapping), and physics-based animations. Includes workflow for choosing the right animation type, implementation patterns, and best practices for performance and user experience.
skill.summary: Comprehensive guide for implementing animations in Flutter. Use when adding motion and visual effect...
skill.author: madteacher

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation/reference skill for Flutter animations. Static scanner flagged Flutter Curve class methods (Curves.easeIn, Curves.bounceIn) as 'certificate/key files' and 'weak cryptographic algorithms' - these are false positives. The backtick detections are markdown code blocks in documentation files. No real security concerns found. Safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Flutter developers struggle to create smooth, performant animations. This skill provides comprehensive guidance on implicit animations, explicit animations, hero transitions, staggered animations, and physics-based motion for polished mobile experiences.
actual_capabilities: Guide on choosing between implicit and explicit animations based on use case
Provide implementation patterns for AnimatedContainer, AnimatedOpacity, TweenAnimationBuilder
Create AnimationController-based explicit animations with custom curves
Implement hero transitions with shared element animations between screens
Build staggered animations with sequential or overlapping timing intervals
Apply physics-based animations using SpringSimulation and FrictionSimulation
limitations: Does not execute code - provides guidance and reference only
Does not include runtime animation libraries or packages
Does not debug animation performance issues directly

use_cases.title: Add fade-in animation to a widget
use_cases.description: Use AnimatedOpacity or FadeTransition for smooth opacity changes when toggling visibility
use_cases.target_user: Flutter developer building a new feature

use_cases.title: Create a hero animation between two screens
use_cases.description: Implement shared element transitions where an image morphs from a thumbnail to full screen
use_cases.target_user: Mobile UI designer implementing screen transitions

use_cases.title: Build a spring-loaded pull-to-refresh
use_cases.description: Use physics-based animations with custom spring parameters for natural, responsive interactions

prompt_templates.title: Basic implicit animation
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I animate a container size change smoothly in Flutter? Show me an example using AnimatedContainer.
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner Flutter developer learning animation basics

prompt_templates.title: Custom explicit animation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a custom animation that rotates a widget 360 degrees over 2 seconds with an ease-in-out curve using AnimationController.
prompt_templates.scenario: Developer needing precise control over animation timing

prompt_templates.title: Hero transition setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a hero animation where a product image transitions from a grid view to a detail view. Include the tag configuration.
prompt_templates.scenario: E-commerce app developer building product pages

prompt_templates.title: Staggered list animation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a staggered animation for a list of items where each item appears 100ms after the previous one, with overlapping fade and slide effects.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building animated onboarding or loading screens

output_examples.input: How do I animate a container color change?
output_examples.output: Use AnimatedContainer with duration and curve parameters. Set the color property to trigger automatic interpolation between old and new values.

output_examples.input: Create a bounce animation for a widget
output_examples.output: Use Curves.bounceIn with your animation curve, or implement a custom BouncingScrollSimulation for physics-based bouncing behavior.

output_examples.input: When should I use implicit vs explicit animations?
output_examples.output: Use implicit animations for simple property changes (opacity, size, color). Use explicit animations when you need complex control: custom controllers, repeat, reverse, or precise timing.

best_practices: Prefer implicit animations for simple property changes - they are easier to implement and maintain
Always specify duration and curve for predictable, polished motion
Dispose AnimationController in dispose() method to prevent memory leaks
Use const constructors where possible to optimize rebuild performance
anti_patterns: Avoid animating expensive properties like layout-affecting changes without understanding performance impact
Do not forget to call dispose() on AnimationController - causes memory leaks
Avoid using excessive animation durations that feel sluggish to users

faq.question: What is the difference between implicit and explicit animations?
faq.answer: Implicit animations (AnimatedContainer, AnimatedOpacity) automatically interpolate between values. Explicit animations (AnimationController, Tween) give you manual control over the animation lifecycle.

faq.question: How do I choose the right animation curve?
faq.answer: Use Curves.linear for constant speed, Curves.easeInOut for natural start/stop, Curves.bounceIn for bouncing effects. Test with your specific use case.

faq.question: Can I create custom curves?
faq.answer: Yes, extend the Curve class and override the transform() method to define custom easing functions.

faq.question: How do hero animations work?
faq.answer: Hero animations use the Hero widget with matching tags on source and destination widgets. Flutter automatically interpolates the transition.

faq.question: What is staggered animation?
faq.answer: Staggered animations play multiple animations in sequence or with overlapping intervals, creating complex motion effects like cascading list items.

faq.question: How do physics-based animations differ from time-based?
faq.answer: Physics animations simulate real-world physics (springs, friction) and respond to user input dynamically, while time-based animations use fixed durations.
